data.title: *PalladiumPaul’s Blog – Page 6 – My Palladium
data.text:
G. David Howard, world’s funniest man, is breaking up the Side Door this Saturday

January 17, 2019

The Funniest Man Alive is coming back to the Side Door this Saturday night (1-19) at 8 p.m. and this time, I’ll be in the audience to laugh along with everyone else. The last time G. David Howard played the Side Door I was on vacation and missed the[…]

Palladium Chamber Players return Wednesday with Haydn, Dvorak, and Mendelssohn

January 15, 2019

We kicked-off our 2018-19 Palladium Chamber Players season in December with a stirring trio performance, but this Wednesday all four of our original players will be onstage performing some exceptional repertoire. Danielle Farina, our violist, is here (literally, the quartet is rehearsing in the hall as I write this),[…]

Jazz piano master, Shelly Berg, is returning to the Palladium Side Door this Thursday

January 7, 2019

Shelly Berg, who’s been called “the best jazz pianist you’ve never heard of,” is actually a familiar name to our audiences. He played the Palladium a few years ago and he’s well known around Florida as a jazz musician and educator. But just in case you are wondering if[…]

Read this great John Lamb profile before you come to Sunday’s big birthday show

January 4, 2019

St. Pete Catalyst, the our town’s online daily news site, published a profile of John Lamb today, just before Sunday’s big John Lamb birthday bash at the Palladium. The 85-year-old jazz bassist is also being honored in February with a MUSE Award from the St. Pete Arts Alliance. […]

Grammy winner, Grammy nominee and the Boogie Woogie King, play the Palladium this weekend

January 2, 2019

We are starting off 2019 with some musical fireworks. Things start lighting up on Saturday, Jan. 5 when Victor Wainwright and The Train make a whistle-stop in our main hall. Victor and the band just picked up a Grammy nomination for Best Contemporary Blues Album, for his latest self-titled[…]

Brand new Grammy nominee Victor Wainwright brings his full band to the Palladium Jan. 5

December 13, 2018

Get your tickets and get on board! Fresh from their Grammy nomination for Best Contemporary Blues Album, Victor Wainwright and The Train are coming to the Palladium on Saturday, Jan. 5. Victor is bringing his full band and he’ll be joined by another boogie woogie piano monster – Bob[…]

Chamber Series debuts tonight at 7:30; read Kurt Loft’s program notes here

December 12, 2018

The Palladium Chamber Players have been rehearsing this week directly above my office and I’ve been enjoying the Bach, Schubert and Tornia (I’m new to his music) they’ve been practicing. I keep my door open and slip upstairs whenever I have a break. So I can tell you, our[…]

TB Times previews the Dec. 12 return of the Palladium Chamber Players

December 11, 2018

Our Palladium Chamber Players are back for 2018-19, and the season starts with a powerhouse concert Wednesday night (12-12) at 7:30 featuring music by Bach, Turina and Schubert. This year’s season has set a new record for subscription sales. Individual tickets are also available for all concerts. Call our[…]

Creative Loafing’s Pick of the Week – Nate Najar’s Jazz Holiday this Thursday!

December 10, 2018

Our pals at Creative Loafing know their music and that’s clearly why they picked Nate Najar’s Jazz Holiday as their featured show of the week. And CL is not alone. Palladium audiences have loved this show for years. We expect more than 450 folks in Hough Hall this Thursday[…]

Only a few tickets left for Jason Marsalis and his NOLA Trad band in the Side Door

December 6, 2018

There are just a handful of tickets remaining for Friday night’s swinging Side Door show featuring Jason Marsalis & the 21st Century Trad Band. Folks are excited about the Palladium debut of this young New Orleans drummer and vibraphonist and his band. They are celebrating their new release on Basin[…]

Nate Najar’s Jazz Holiday returns next week with top local and international players

December 5, 2018

This year’s edition of Nate Najar’s Jazz Holiday features a line-up of local and international jazz stars and promises to be one of the best shows of the year at the Palladium. Nate starts with some of our favorite local players, including birthday boy John Lamb, (We’ll be celebrating[…]

Major Chopin biography appears in advance of our all-Chopin piano program this Thursday

December 3, 2018

Just in time for our all-Chopin program performed by famed pianist Arthur Greene (Hough Hall, Thursday, Dec. 6 at 7:30) there’s a new biography of the Polish composer. A review of the book made the front cover of the New York Times book review last week. Chopin and his[…]

Famed pianist Arthur Greene performs Chopin favorites and rarities next Thursday

November 29, 2018

Our collaboration with The Chopin Project continues to bring award-winning pianists to the Palladium stage. I am particularly excited about the upcoming concert on Thursday, Dec. 6, featuring Arthur Greene. Greene, who earned first prize in both William Kapell and Gina Bachauer International Piano Competitions, will be performing an[…]

Cyber Monday means a day of great discounts on your favorite Palladium shows

November 24, 2018

Cyber Monday is here and there are more than just discounts on electronics and clothes this year. You’re favorite local venue is offering ONE-DAY-ONLY discounts on lots of our major shows coming up in 2018 and 2019. Here’s a list with links to our box office. Use promo code:[…]

Latimore, Damon Fowler featured in Living Blues Magazine and elsewhere this month

November 14, 2018

Living Blues Magazine is a top notch publication – now on issue number 257 – that is just about as close to the Bible of the blues as we’ve got. And two of our favorite artists – Latimore and Damon Fowler – show up in this month’s issue and[…]

We’ve added a dance floor since NYC’s best swing dance band is here Thursday night

November 9, 2018

Come get your dancing shoes out for New York City’s hottest swing dance band! Adrian Cunningham, the clarinet and sax master, leads New York’s hottest swing dance band, Professor Cunningham and His Old School. They are taking top honors at international swing festivals, and are the in-demand swing unit[…]

Chopin Project bringing top musicians to our stage; the first concert is coming up Tuesday evening

November 9, 2018

Orchestral and classical music is a big part of what we do at the Palladium. And I’m thrilled when we find partners who share that passion for this incredible musical legacy. Starting with one concert last year, we have embraced The Chopin Project, a performance and educational effort of[…]

The blues world is raving about John Nemeth; hear him Friday in the Side Door

November 7, 2018

John Nemeth, one of the brightest stars in the blues firmament, is returning to the Palladium this Friday night with his full horn band. You’ve got the chance to hear this exciting performer in the intimate Side Door Cabaret. And our own Backtrack Blues Band will open the show[…]

Get yer blues on at the Palladium, starting with Rusty Wright in the Side Door TONIGHT

November 2, 2018

The Palladium is delivering some top drawer blues over the next few months and it all starts TONIGHT! Tonight we’re welcoming the blues rocker Rusty Wright, a Billboard Top 10 artist, to the Side Door. Get ready for a night of Chicago-style blues, southern rock and more from this[…]

Celebrate Fall tonight with Whitney James and her jazz quartet in the Side Door

November 1, 2018

The wonderful Whitney James is in the Side Door tonight celebrating the cooler weather with a selection of tunes she’s calling “Fall In Love With Jazz.” I was going to tell you about it, but I asked Whitney to write a few thoughts down and when I got her[…]

SPF 18, showcasing St. Pete’s best talent and great guests, hits the Palladium this weekend

October 26, 2018

We’re so proud to be part of SPF18, the showcase of St. Pete’s finest performers. Tonight we’re hosting the American Stage Improv Festival, which features a stellar lineup of artists including my heroes, Hawk and Wayne, performers from Florida Studio Theater, The Box, and headliners Improv Boston. That show[…]

One last chance to enjoy Mozart’s music and the “glorious harmonies” of SPO’s Don Giovanni

October 22, 2018

Tuesday night is the final performance of St. Petersburg Opera’s latest hit, Mozart’s Don Giovanni. Tampa Bay Times critic Andrew Meacham praised this season opening production. There are still some tickets remaining for Tuesday’s 7:30 performance. Call the Palladium box office at 727-822-3590 or follow this link for on-line[…]

Don’t miss Steinway Artist Rebecca Penneys in concert at SPC’s Music Center Friday

October 9, 2018

We’re blessed to have pianist Rebecca Penneys calling our area home. She is an internationally known concert artist and was a long-time professor of piano at the famed Eastman School of Music. She is the founder and continues to lead the Rebecca Penneys Piano Festival, a training ground for[…]

Have Gun celebrates Bill Graham with a Last Waltz tribute concert Saturday at the Palladium

October 4, 2018

Our friends at the Florida Holocaust Museum are in the middle of an exciting new exhibition called Bill Graham and the Rock and Roll Revolution. Graham escaped the Holocaust as a child, but lost his mother at Auschwitz. Graham went on to become the greatest promoter in rock history, known[…]

Catch Apple Records’ “King of Fuh” Friday in the Side Door; he inspired Paul McCartney’s new single

October 2, 2018

Our Friday night stand-up comedy show in the Side Door features none other than Brute Force, the King of Fuh. And for a guy who first emerged in the 1960s as a songwriter and singer, he’s on a complete roll in 2018! The hottest album release in the world[…]

Nate’s Paris CD release is Thursday in the Side Door; check out my interview with him here

October 1, 2018

Got to sit down with Nate Najar last week for a good conversation. He was fresh off the airplane from shows in England and France all in conjunction with the release of his new album of French tunes – Under Paris Skies. The local release party is this Thursday, Oct.[…]

Just back from Paris and London, Nate Najar is here on his way to NYC’s Blue Note

September 26, 2018

Just visited with Nate Najar who is fresh off the airplane from shows in England and France all in conjunction with the release of his new album of French tunes – Under Paris Skies. The local release party is in the Side Door on Thursday, Oct. 4 at 7:30 p.m.[…]

Florida Bjorkestra returns to the Palladium Saturday with an even bigger 2018 Buffyfest

September 25, 2018

OK, I’m not in the demographic for Buffy The Vampire Slayer. But that didn’t stop me from LOVING last year’s Buffyfest. And I’m so excited about the even bigger return of Buffyfest in 2018 that I might have to go out and drive a stake through someone’s vampire heart. […]

After gigs with Di Meola and Sandoval, Phil Magallanes brings his jazz trio to the Side Door

September 21, 2018

One great thing about the growth of this area – especially in the arts – is the talented folks who are choosing St. Pete and the Tampa Bay area as their home base., One of the best is Phil Magallanes, an incredible pianist and arranger. He’s brought his Phil’s[…]

Our “delightful” Webb’s City – The Musical is here this weekend. CL calls it a must-see show!

September 19, 2018

Our 2018 staging of Webb’s City – The Musical has a lot going for it. For one, the show is going up without the threat of a killer hurricane bearing down on our city. (Remember Irma?) And most of the cast members from last year’s production are back. When[…]

The musical Webb’s City returns this weekend to another ‘Burg landmark – The Palladium

September 17, 2018

Doc Webb not only created the first “superstore” in America, he put St. Petersburg on the national map and inspired one of my favorite musicals. This weekend the Palladium is bringing back Webb’s City – The Musical. We’ve got lots of folks coming who have seen this show before[…]

WEDU loses a leader and the Palladium loses a friend with the passing of Susan Howarth

September 13, 2018

For the past 10 years the Palladium has enjoyed a successful partnership with Tampa Bay’s public television station, WEDU. First with Dick Lobo at the helm, and when he retired, his successor Susan Howarth continued the relationship without missing a beat. She went out of her way to befriend[…]

After sharing a Chicago stage with Buddy Guy, Lauren Mitchell returns for a big Side Door show

September 12, 2018

Lauren Mitchell has long been a favorite down here. And it has been fun to watch her career advance – due not only to her great voice and stage presence – but the way she has built her musical dream one album and one tour at a time. Nobody works[…]

The La Lucha guys define “Pa’ Lante” and explore Zen and the art of an album release party

September 10, 2018

We love being the place where Tampa Bay’s best bands and artists release their new material. One of our favorite jazz groups, La Lucha, will release their new album, “Pa’ Lante” in the Side Door on Friday, Sept. 14 at 8. You can get tickets and information by calling[…]

International Blues star Selwyn Birchwood and his band are back in the Side Door for two nights

September 4, 2018

Part of the fun of my job is finding talented young performers and making them part of the Palladium family. A few years ago, one of those youngsters was a guy right out of the University of South Florida named Selwyn Birchwood. We loved him from the start –[…]

We’re resting over Labor Day, but the Palladium swings into action for the rest of September

August 28, 2018

Your favorite local venue has become one of the busiest places in Tampa Bay over the past 10 years. The Palladium at SPC now produces a season of shows that run virtually non-stop from late September to mid-June. And we don’t really rest in the summer, we just produce[…]

Check out photos from our wonderful Cannonball and Nancy jazz show last week

August 22, 2018

Wanted to share some photos of our Cannonball and Nancy jazz concert last Thursday. The concert featured Jack Wilkins and an all-star band in the Side Door. It was part of our Summer of Soul series. Cannonball and Nat Adderley, both Tampa-born and Florida-raised, certainly fit that bill. Larry[…]

“Girls Night Out” brings three of Florida’s funniest women to the Side Door stage this Friday

August 21, 2018

Michael Murillo is one of the funniest guys I know. And he proves it on stage regularly, opening for Amy Schumer and Tig Notaro, and delivering a very funny set in a Side Door stand-up night at the Palladium last year. Michael produces “Girls Night Out,” a night of comedy[…]

Soul legend Latimore makes a rare Tampa Bay appearance Saturday in the Side Door

August 20, 2018

Latimore, I learned from John Capouya’s book, Florida Soul, doesn’t play where he lives, and since he lives in Riverview, that means the Blues Hall of Famer and veteran soul man doesn’t play in Tampa Bay. Except this Saturday night, when Latimore and his band take the stage in the[…]

Check out Damon Fowler’s new CD or pick it up Friday night at his Side Door show

August 16, 2018

The first blues act we brought to the Side Door has proven to be one of our all-time favorites – Damon Fowler. When Damon and his trio play here, the Side Door transforms into a laid-back Sugar Shack and the band and the audience have some down-home Florida fun. […]

Whitney James, Jack Wilkins and lots of our jazz faves bring Cannonball and Nancy to the Side Door

August 14, 2018

Our Summer of Soul theme is a celebration of John Capouya’s new book, Florida Soul, which chronicles the history of soul pioneers from the Sunshine State. One name that shows up a lot in John’s book is Cannonball Adderley. Perhaps the greatest jazz player – along with his brother Nat[…]

Tonight’s Jamie Perlow “Love Letters” concert is picked as a “top show of the weekend!”

August 10, 2018

I love it when one of our Side Door shows is picked as a “must see show this weekend” alongside such big entertainment offerings as Imagine Dragons and Disney’s The Lion King. TBN newspaper group did just that singling out tonight’s Love Letters concert featuring Jamie Perlow on vocals[…]

We’ve got photos from great nights with Nate and Little Jake in the Side Door

August 9, 2018

What a magical weekend at the Palladium with Nate Najar’s Bossa Nova Guitars last Friday and Saturday night’s soul-tastic evening with Little Jake and the Soul Searchers. Both nights were sold-out and everyone was happy they came out. Nate and Phill Fest have performed here together in the past,[…]

Music is in Jamie Perlow’s DNA; catch her Love Letters concert this Friday

August 7, 2018

Somehow, I hadn’t heard Jamie Perlow sing until the night she fronted The Florida Bjorkestra, in a concert of Bjork’s unforgettable music. Now, I can’t get enough of Jamie’s powerful, evocative voice and her commanding stage presence. If you haven’t heard her sing with The Florida Bjorkestra, or the[…]

Rev. Billy is coming to the Side Door next Sunday (8-12) to heal your boogie woogie soul!

August 3, 2018

As we planned out Summer of Soul program I knew we needed to give our patrons a “religious experience.” So of course, I had to call Rev. Billy C. Wirtz. He’s the Master of The 88 Key Disaster, King of the Atomic Boogie, the paino man who can make you[…]

St. Pete soul legend, Frankie Gearing, to join Little Jake in Side Door on Saturday night

August 1, 2018

Just a quick update on Saturday’s show featuring Little Jake Mitchell and his large band, The Soul Searchers. I just found out St. Pete’s own Frankie Gearing, another veteran of the classic soul era, will join Little Jake for several songs during the Side Door show Saturday night. Both[…]

Summer of Soul starts hot with two sellouts; don’t miss the excitement this weekend!

July 30, 2018

Wow. I knew I liked our great summer lineup for soul, jazz and comedy – a series we’re calling the Summer of Soul – but it’s great to know our audiences agree with me. Last weekends shows were both sold out. Jeremy Carter brought a killer band and great[…]

Mr. Excitement, Little Jake Mitchell, returns with his large band to the Side Door

July 25, 2018

Little Jake Mitchell couldn’t help himself, he was always going to be a singer. Born in Tampa, he was discovered when a man heard him singing in the background of a telephone call and had to know “that singer.” Henry Urso, a Tampa businessman, immediately got him down[…]

Summer of Soul kicks off Friday with jazz takes on classic soul by sax man Jeremy Carter

July 23, 2018

We’re kicking off our Summer of Soul series this weekend with two “must-see” shows in our intimate Side Door Cabaret. Saturday night we’ve got a powerful R&B double-bill featuring The Dukes of Juke and the big horn band, Blue Dice. I’ll be writing about that show later this week.[…]
